questions.question: 1. Let \( T:\mathbb{R}^n ightarrow \mathbb{R}^n \) be the one-to-one onto linear transformation and let \( T(X)=b, b \in \mathbb{R}^n \), be a linear map equation. Then it has

2. Let \( T:\mathbb{R}^3 ightarrow \mathbb{R}^2 \) be the linear transformation defined by \( T(x, y, z)=(x, y+z) \), where \( x, y, z \in \mathbb{R} \). Consider the linear map equation \( T(X)=b \), where \( b=(1, 0) \). Then

answers.a: Solution exists and there are infinitely many solutions
answers.b: Solution exists and there are finite but more than one solutions

questions.question: 3. Let \( T:\mathbb{R}^2 ightarrow \mathbb{R}^3 \) be the linear transformation defined by \( T(x, y)=(x, x+y, x-y) \), where \( x, y \in \mathbb{R} \). Consider the linear map equation \( T(X)=b \), where \( b=(1, 0, 0) \). Then

answers.a: Solution exists and there are infinitely many solutions
answers.b: Solution exists and there are finite but more than one number of solutions

questions.question: 4. Let \( T:\mathbb{R}^2 ightarrow \mathbb{R}^2 \) be the linear transformation defined by \( T(x, y)=(3x, 4x) \), where \( x, y \in \mathbb{R} \) and let \( b=(3, 4) \). Then which of the following is a solution of the linear map equation \( T(X)=b \)

5. Let \( T:\mathbb{R}^2 ightarrow \mathbb{R}^2 \) be the linear transformation defined by \( T(x, y)=(y, 0) \), where \( x, y \in \mathbb{R} \). Let the statements A and B be as given below:
A: The linear map equation \( T(X)=(1, 4) \) is consistent.
B: The linear map equation \( T(X)=(4, 0) \) is consistent.
Then which of the following holds

answers.a: A is true, B is false
answers.b: A is false, B is true
answers.c: A is true, B is true
answers.d: A is false, B is false
